statement:
Let $(X_i)_{i\in I}$ be a family of nonempty topological spaces. The
product space (see product topology) $$\prod_{i\in I}X_i$$ is compact if
and only if each of the spaces $X_i$ is compact.

Not surprisingly, if $I$ is infinite, the proof requires the Axiom of
Choice. Conversely, one can show that Tychonoff’s theorem implies that
any product of nonempty sets is nonempty, which is one form of the Axiom
of Choice.
